:::{#person-profile}
:::

YJ Choe is a fifth-year joint Ph.D. student in Statistics and Machine Learning
at Carnegie Mellon University, advised by Prof. Aaditya Ramdas. He is broadly
interested in statistical machine learning, with a recent focus on sequential
inference, game-theoretic statistics, forecast evaluation, and causal inference.
Previously, YJ was an industry researcher working on deep learningmethods for
natural language processing.
